children.name: Modern Service Oriented Architecture
children.detail:
What does Service Oriented Architecture really mean? When is it 
relevant? Why might it be interesting? What are the risks? How does it 
relate to technologies such as web services, message queues and service 
busses? How does it fit in with business processes, modeling and 
agility? And - most critically - how can it be put to use in order to 
build solutions that deliver value, enable the business to evolve, and 
are reliable, scalable and secure?

children.name: CQRS, DDD and Event Sourcing: What it really means
children.detail:
This fast-paced 1-day seminar focuses on how Domain Driven Design, 
Command Query Responsibility Segregation and Event Sourcing come 
together to help us capture business requirements and map them into 
loosely coupled, well tested, to-the-point code.

children.name: Modern Business Applications with DDD and CQRS
children.detail:
This course aims to teach a direct, hands-on way to approach business 
applications. While explaining the theory along the way, the focus is 
firmly on producing business software that's more useful, usable, 
testable, maintainable, and easier to understand than traditional ways 
of building business applications.

children.name: Modern Service Oriented Architecture
children.detail:
What does Service Oriented Architecture really mean? When is it 
relevant? Why might it be interesting? What are the risks? How does it 
relate to technologies such as web services, message queues and service 
busses? How does it fit in with business processes, modeling and 
agility? And - most critically - how can it be put to use in order to 
build solutions that deliver value, enable the business to evolve, and 
are reliable, scalable and secure?

children.name: Software Architecture
children.detail:
This course will help you design your systems to cope with challenges 
around design concerns and constraints, how to map customer requirements
 to software, and how to avoid it all to turn into mud.

children.name: Requirements Development using Product Based Planning plus Estimating & Scheduling
children.detail:
Product based planning enables us to progressively develop the 
requirements for building a product or service. This in turn means that 
we can get feedback from the market or internally regarding the 
suitability of the product(s) being developed. Based on the lessons 
learned the project team can make controlled changes to the product or 
service requirements to ensure that business objectives are met.

children.name: Beginning ASP.NET MVC 4 with Test Driven Development
children.detail:
This course will give your ASP.NET MVC 4 development a solid start - in 
the right direction! It picks out and explains the things you need to 
know in order to use the framework effectively and develop testable 
solutions. While the course has a focus on practical skills, it also 
takes the time to explain important underlying concepts, including how 
HTTP works, the MVC design pattern, the TDD workflow and dependency 
inversion.

children.name: C# Master Class
children.detail:
This class covers advanced topics with focus on modern architecture and 
development practices, clean code and focus on real-life use cases. 
Using the skills learned will help you produce better quality software 
more efficiently.

children.name: Beginning C# using .NET 4.0
children.detail:
This course gets you started with the C# language and the .NET 
framework. It will help you to understand the basic syntax and cover the
 most important parts of the class library. It will also give you a 
solid foundation in object oriented development, covering both 
inheritance and interface implementation. The course is delivered by 
experienced developers who will show you the best way to write C# 
according to modern best practices.

children.name: Intermediate C# using .NET 4.0
children.detail:
Using C# effectively means going beyond the object oriented features of 
the language. Effective C# developers make good use of generics, LINQ 
(Language Integrated Query) and lambda expressions. They use 
enumerations, nullable types, initializers and extension methods to 
write cleaner code that is easier to refactor. This course steadily 
takes developers with a working knowledge of the object oriented 
features at the core of the C# language to the next level.

children.name: Getting Started with ASP.NET MVC 3
children.detail:
Want to start developing with ASP.NET MVC? Spend 2 days learning the key
 things you need to know in order to use the framework effectively!

children.name: Modern TDD in .Net
children.detail: this course draws on a wealth of real world experiences to show you how to apply TDD in .NET.

children.name: Parallel and Asynchronous Programming in C# 5
children.detail:
Will teach you parallel and async development using concurrent 
collections, parallel looping constructs, PLINQ, Tasks, the new 
async/await keywords in C# 5, the Reactive Extensions (Rx), the TPL 
Dataflow library with its Actor-based development.

children.name: Productive development with ReSharper
children.detail:
Unleash your productivity in Visual Studio 2010 using the ReSharper 7 
add-on. ReSharper is a refactoring and productivity tool which extends 
the functionality of Visual Studio, making it a better IDE.

children.name: Beginning Java
children.detail:
Med denna kurs kommer du igång med Java från början. Kursen hjälper dig 
förstå språkets grundläggande syntax och täcker de viktigaste delarna av
 klassbiblioteket. Den kommer även att ge dig en solid grund i 
objektorienterad programmering, där både arv och implementation av 
interface gås igenom. Kursen levereras av erfarna utvecklare som kommer 
att visa dig det bästa sättet att skriva modern Java kod.

children.name: Intermediate Java
children.detail:
Kursen riktar sig till dig som redan har lite erfarenhet av Java men 
vill gå vidare och fördjupa dig i språket. Vi tittar på konstruktioner i
 språket som bland annat Threads. Vi fördjupar oss i best practices i 
objektorienterad design och ser hur vi effektivt kan skapa en java 
applikation utifrån detta.

children.name: Modern TDD in Java
children.detail: this course draws on a wealth of real world experiences to show you how to apply TDD in Java.

children.name: Foundation for Successful Project Management
children.detail:
This concentrated one day overview on the foundations for successful 
project management will give participants an insight to what is involved
 in delivering projects successfully every time. Irrespective of the 
methodologies currently used in your organization. In this course we 
give an overview as to how you can combine practices from PMI, PRINCE2, 
CCPM and Scrum.

we can get feedback from the market or internally regarding the 
suitability of the product(s) being developed. Based on the lessons 
learned the project team can make controlled changes to the product or 
service requirements to ensure that business objectives are met.
